org.eclipse.january.metadata

Interface AxesMetadata

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, MetadataType, Serializable

    public interface AxesMetadata
extends MetadataType
    This metadata describes any axis information associated with a dataset. Dimension numbers are zero-based, i.e. the first dimension is numbered zero.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      • Methods inherited from interface org.eclipse.january.metadata.MetadataType

        clone

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(int rank)
        Parameters:
        rank -

      • getAxes

        ILazyDataset[] getAxes()
        Get axis datasets
        Returns:
        all axis datasets, any nulls represent default integer indexes, each axis is the main specified axis. i.e the result of getAxis(n)[0]

      • getAxis

        ILazyDataset[] getAxis(int axisDim)
        Get all axis datasets for the given dimension
        Parameters:
        axisDim - dimension (n.b. this is zero-based)
        Returns:
        axis datasets, null represent default integer indexes, the order is in inverse importance.

      • setAxis

        void setAxis(int axisDim,
           ILazyDataset... axisData)
        Set axis datasets for given dimension. These datasets must be one dimensional or match rank with the associating dataset
        Parameters:
        axisDim -
        axisData -

      • addAxis

        void addAxis(int i,
           ILazyDataset lazyDataset)
        Add axis data to given dimension. This dataset must be one dimensional or match rank with the associating dataset
        Parameters:
        axisDim - dimension (n.b. this is zero-based)
        axisData - dataset for axis

      • addAxis

        void addAxis(int primaryAxisDim,
           ILazyDataset iLazyDataset,
           int... dimMapping)
        Parameters:
        primaryAxisDim - primary dimension (n.b. this is zero-based)
        iLazyDataset -
        dimMapping - indicates where each axis dimension maps to in the dataset dimensions

      • refresh

        int[] refresh(int[] shape)
        Refresh with given shape
        Parameters:
        shape -
        Returns:
        new shape
